ostViewIn3D.FullDescription: It is possible to dynamically change the dimensions of the view cubes uniformly in all directions relative to the selected elements

mprExteriorPlanDimensions.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to put in one click the external dimensions on the floor plan. Plugin only processes horizontal and vertical walls and axes. mprNestedFamilyParamsTransfer.Description: Plugin allows you to simplify the work of establishing a associating between the parameters of nested families with the parameters of the parent family
mprNestedFamilyParamsTransfer.FullDescription: Using the plugin, you can create new parameters in the parent family based on one or more parameters of nested families. There is a possibility to set a mask for the name of the created parameter by adding a prefix or suffix. Plugin also allows you to set and delete a link to existing parameters of the parent family

mprWallsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement according to given conditions of walls and openings
mprWallsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin works only with walls located in one level. Plugin analyzes the walls, allowing you to find three types of intersections (corner, end and cross) and openings. Flexible grouping allows you to specify exactly what type of reinforcement should be made. You can perform reinforcement only for the specified groups - walls, intersections or openings. Plugin can work even on an empty template

If the bends of the rebars can not be performed in two directions, the rebars are bent in one direction in different levels of the slab

mprWallsReinforcement.jtd6: Straight joints of vertical rebars in the form of a "bottle" are created - the bends are bent to the center of intersection to the diameter of the rebar. The overlap length is set from the top of the overlying slab
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd7: Joints are created in the overlying slab in the form of separate L-shaped bars. The first anchoring length - the length of the anchoring of the rods into the slab - is counted from the side face of the wall. The second anchoring length - the length of the anchoring of the rods into the wall - is counted from the top edge of the wall. If the bends of the rebars can not be performed in two directions, the rebars are bent in one direction in different levels of the slab
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd8: Created straight joints of vertical rebars without taking into account the overlying elements
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd9: Straight joints of vertical rebars in the form of a “bottle” are created - the bends are bent to the center of the wall at a given distance or by the diameter of the rebar. The overlap length is set from the top of the overlying slab
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd10: The vertical rebars of the background reinforcement are cut along the top of the wall according to the specified value of cover from the rebars ends. Create an anchoring into the overlying slab in the form of a separate U-shaped rod

mprWallsReinforcement.t44: α is a coefficient that takes into account the effect on the anchoring length of the stress state of concrete and reinforcement and the structural solution of the element in the anchoring zone. When anchoring rods of a periodic profile with straight ends (straight anchoring) or smooth reinforcement with hooks or loops without additional anchoring devices for stretched rods, take α = 1.0, and for compressed ones - α = 0.75. According to clause 10.3.30 of SP 63.13330, the coefficient α may be increased to 2.0
mprWallsReinforcement.t45: According to paragraph 10.3.8 of SP 63.13330.2012, the vertical bars take no more than 2t and 400 mm (t is the thickness of the wall)

mprWallsReinforcement.t47: Increases the time of the reinforcement generation!

mprWallsReinforcement.t60: If the joints exceed the height of the overlying wall, they will be cut off along the upper face of the wall, taking into account the specified ends cover of the rebars
mprWallsReinforcement.t61: The selection variant applies to the selection of foundation plates
mprWallsReinforcement.t62: The vertical rebar is moved to the place where the U-shaped rebar bend begins, which is obtained by adding the values of the cover layer of the horizontal reinforcement from the ends, the diameter of the U-shaped rebar and the standard bending diameter of the U-shaped rebar
mprWallsReinforcement.t63: You can specify preferred rebar shapes for different types of rebars created by the plugin.
mprWallsReinforcement.t64: Setting the preferred shapes does not guarantee that the reinforcement will be created using the specified shape of the rebar.
mprWallsReinforcement.t65: When creating rebars, an attempt will be made to use the specified shape. If creating a rebar with the specified shape is not possible, Revit will automatically search for a suitable shape or create a new shape.
mprWallsReinforcement.t66: Save current reinforcement settings as default reinforcement settings
mprWallsReinforcement.t67: Group walls, intersections and openings according to the current grouping settings
mprWallsReinforcement.t68: When this option is enabled, stirrups will not be created at intersections of walls and at the ends of walls where details are created (for example, U-shaped details)
mprWallsReinforcement.t69: If the horizontal bars of the background reinforcement are on the inside and the vertical bars are on the outside, it is recommended to specify the girth of the vertical bars. For the opposite case, when the horizontal bars of the background reinforcement are located outside, it is recommended to specify the girth of the horizontal bars
mprWallsReinforcement.t70: The length of the detail is taken as the length of the anchoring
mprWallsReinforcement.t71: Each second pair of rods will be indented at the bottom by a distance equal to the absolute value of the overlap length difference. The indentation does not affect the second overlap length. For example, if the first overlap length is 500 mm and the second overlap length is 750 mm, then the rods of each second pair will be indented from below 250 mm

mprSlabsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement of slabs for specified conditions
mprSlabsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to process both individually selected slabs, and all slabs in the view or in the document. The main reinforcement of the slab can be performed as separate rebars, or area reinforcement. The analysis of holes is made from the geometry of the slab itself and does not depend on the used families. Plugin can work even on an empty template

mprColumnsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement of columns for specified conditions
mprColumnsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to process both individually selected columns and all columns in a view or in a document. Reinforcement is carried out taking into account the relative position of the columns above each other. Transverse reinforcement can be assembled using a variety of rebar shape options. Plugin can work even on an empty template

mmOrderMarking.Description: Adding numbering to the specified parameter of elements with the possibility of numbering in the schedules
mmOrderMarking.FullDescription: When working in a non-schedule view, you can specify the direction of numbering based on the arrangement of elements, or add numbering in the order in which elements were created. When working in a schedule, the plugin adds numbering in the order of items in the schedule (taking into account sorting). It is possible to set the prefix and suffix for the number
mmOrderMarking.h10: Search (enter * to display only selected items)
mmOrderMarking.h15: has the "Read Only" property for the following elements
mmOrderMarking.h16: It is not possible to change the instance parameter for an element located in a group if the parameter "Values ​​can vary by group instances" is not enabled for the parameter or it is not the "Mark" system parameter
mmOrderMarking.h17: Errors occurred while changing the parameter values ​​of the listed items
mmOrderMarking.h18: Attention! The parameter is cleared for all elements of this schedule, regardless of the filtering settings. This means that if, for example, 10 columns are presented in the schedule, and only 5 columns are displayed in the filter settings, then the parameter will be cleared for all 10 columns! Clear parameter?
mmOrderMarking.h23: If rows are selected before running the plugin, the plugin will number only the selected rows
mmOrderMarking.h28: The "{0}" parameter has a "Read-only" property. Make sure that the elements to be processed are not in a Workset that is not available to you for editing
mmOrderMarking.t1: The work of the plugin is possible only in the schedule in the sorting settings of which the property "Itemize every instance" is checked
mmOrderMarking.t3: Standard frame selection - selection of elements in the current view with a frame with confirmation of the selection by pressing the "Finish" button. With this option, the numbering direction has five options - in the order of creation and by the position of the elements.
mmOrderMarking.t4: Ordinal selection - selects each element for numbering in the order in which the numbering will be performed. With this option, the direction of numbering can be ascending or descending. Completion of the selection is invoked by pressing the Esc key.
mmOrderMarking.t5: Curve intersection - Select a curve (model line or detail line). The elements for numbering will be selected by finding the intersection of the curve with the geometry of the elements in the current view, projected onto the plane of the view. With this option, the direction of numbering can be ascending or descending.
mmOrderMarking.t6: It is possible to apply a filter by category and/or parameters to all element selections.
mmOrderMarking.t7: The list of parameters is filled in after selecting the elements for numbering.
mmOrderMarking.t8: For schedules that have the "Itemized" checkbox unchecked, there are two algorithms for determining positions:
mmOrderMarking.t9: Through deletion of rows - fast algorithm. This algorithm does not always work correctly, as there are cases when it is impossible to delete rows, and there are cases when deleting some rows leads to other rows.
mmOrderMarking.t10: Through signal value - is a slow algorithm. This algorithm requires constant regeneration of the specification, which leads to high time costs. The more elements in the schedule, the more time is required.
mmOrderMarking.t11: It is recommended to use the fast algorithm first. If the fast algorithm fails, then use the slow algorithm
mmOrderMarking.t12: The initial value can be a fractional value. A point or comma can be used to separate the integer part from the fractional part. The specified separator will be used when setting values in the text parameter. If the target parameter is of data type "Number", the specified separator will not affect the displayed result. If the target parameter is of data type "Integer", the numbering result will be converted to an integer by discarding the fractional part.
mmOrderMarking.t13: Leading zeros can be added to the initial value. For example, if the initial value is "01", and the step is "5", then the numbering result will be "01, 05, 10, 15...". Initial zeros are only taken into account if the target parameter has a string data type.
mmOrderMarking.t14: The geometric direction of numbering is calculated by the absolute values of X and Y of the element placement points. For linear objects the middle point is taken

mmOrderMarking.m3: Filter selected elements by the current list of categories?

mprSheetRenumber.Description: Plugin allows to renumber sheets in the project
mprSheetRenumber.FullDescription: Renumbering of sheets is carried out within one group of sheets. You can display all sheets by analogy with the current settings of the project manager or display all sheets in one group. There is an opportunity to change the position of sheets by moving them in the group, while maintaining the initial numbering of sheets in this group

The number can be made static or dynamic (increasing or decreasing). The whole sheet number, part or part number can be written to the specified parameter

mprPatterns.Description: Fill patterns manager with the ability to import, export, edit and create
mprPatterns.FullDescription: It is possible to edit the type of existing fill patterns, to increase or decrease the scale of existing fill patterns. There is batch import from pat files and batch export to pat files. New fill patterns can be created using standard tools with offset and angle, using the conversion of drafting views, and with using a graphical editor

mprContextFilter.Description: Filter elements by parameters, which works as a context menu
mprContextFilter.FullDescription: The filter is launched in one of three ways: by left-clicking the mouse while holding down the Ctrl key, by sequential pressing of keys, or by pressing a key combination. The filter has three processing levels - all elements of the model, elements in the current view, or selected elements. There is the ability to use presets for quick filter use.

mprContextFilter.h26: The context filter dialog is called by successive pressing of the indicated keys. The default sequence is “F, F”. The time interval between keystrokes is not taken into account. When specifying a sequence, consider the assigned Revit hot keys
mprContextFilter.h27: The context filter dialog is called by pressing the specified key combination. The default key combination is “Shift + F”. When specifying a different combination, consider existing combinations (Ctrl + C, Ctrl + V and others)

mprCopyParameterValues.Description: Copy parameter values between elements or within one element
mprCopyParameterValues.FullDescription: The plugin contains various copying options, allowing you to configure which elements to copy to. There is a possibility of copying a composite value (from several parameters to one). There are filters for selecting items by category and parameter values. There is an opportunity to convert values between different types of parameters

mprCopyParameterValues.i1: The input fields before and after the names of the source parameters allow you to create a formula for the calculation.
mprCopyParameterValues.i2: To create a formula, you can use simple arithmetic operators such as "+", "-", "*", "/", parentheses, and mathematical functions:
mprCopyParameterValues.i4: Pow - taking a number to a specified power,
mprCopyParameterValues.i5: Sqrt - getting the square root of the number.
mprCopyParameterValues.i6: When using functions, the values to be processed must be in parentheses. For example, if you want to get an absolute value of a parameter, enter "Abs(" in the field before the parameter name and ")" in the field after the parameter name.
mprCopyParameterValues.i7: For a complete list of functions, see the help page.

mprCopyParameterValues.i1: You can enter multiple valid values in the "Values" field, separated by a comma. A parameter is considered to satisfy the condition if its value matches at least one valid value.
mprCopyParameterValues.i2: The condition "Presence of parameter" means that the element will be processed if there is such a parameter, regardless of the parameter value.
mprCopyParameterValues.i3: String parameters are checked only by the conditions "Equal", "Not equal", "Contains", "Not contains".
mprCopyParameterValues.i4: Numeric parameters are checked by all conditions except "Contains".
mprCopyParameterValues.i5: The "Contains" condition checks that the element parameter contains at least one of the valid values. The condition "Not contains", respectively, checks that the parameter does not contain at least one of the values.
mprCopyParameterValues.i7: Parameters of type "on/off" are checked as an integer (0-off, 1-on).

mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction1: All rooms in the project must have the shared parameters specified in this list. You can use your own shared parameters of the same type (specified in parentheses). Specify your own shared parameters in the list or click the "Create missing parameters" button. All numeric parameters are represented by the "Currency" type, which allows to process rooms in groups
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction2: In the room matrix the basic properties for the selection of the processed rooms, the numbering of rooms in the apartment, as well as the values for the calculation of the apartment areas are set. The values from the matrix are selected by matching the functional purpose (FN column) and the room name. In the "Room name" column you can specify an asterisk at the end of the name, which will indicate a check for a match at the beginning of the room name (for example, the value "Bedroom*" will match the room names "Bedroom 1", "Bedroom 2", etc.)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction2_1: This table specifies the data used to define the apartment type. The values "Contains rooms" and " Not contains rooms" are filled in with the names of rooms, separated by semicolons (;)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction3: The initial check includes two parts: a check for unplaced rooms and a check for the occupancy of the parameters "Functional purpose" and "Name". If the value of the "Functional purpose" parameter corresponds to the value of the "Apartment Identifier" specified in the settings, then the "Name" parameter will be checked against the current room matrix
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction4: The apartments are collected through the geometric characteristics of the rooms, taking into account the connection of the rooms through windows, doors and room separators. All rooms of the same apartment are assigned the same value of the "Apartment ID" parameter. It is recommended to perform an additional visual check by creating a color scheme according to the "Apartment ID" parameter
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction5: Apartment calculation includes calculating the areas of the apartment, the number of living rooms, as well as determining the type of apartment using the "Apartment types" source. All obtained values are assigned to the parameters of the rooms included in the apartment. All apartments are defined according to the value of the "Apartment ID" parameter set at the "Collect apartments" step
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction6: Numbering can be done by grouping the apartments by Housings and/or Sections by enabling the corresponding options and by specifying the parameter names from which to take the value of the Housing and/or Sections. In this case, it is considered that the sections are subgroups for the housings. The "End-to-end numbering" property means that the numbering in the next group will continue, not start from the value set in the "Initial number" property. If you select the " Point " option in the "Start of numbering" property, you will need to select a room for each group of apartments
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction7: Creating apartment views is done by duplicating the current view, followed by cropping along the contour of the apartment. First of all, an attempt is made to create a crop contour considering the thickness of the enclosing walls (only for Revit 2020 and higher). If unsuccessful, an attempt is made to create a crop contour taking into account the thickest of the enclosing walls. If the crop contour is not created, the apartment contour obtained from the room boundaries will be used. If the option "Try to use apartment type as view name" is enabled, the created views will be given a name of the type "LEVEL_NAME - Apartment APARTMENT_TYPE".
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction8: The apartment editor allows you to make manual changes to the values of the apartment areas, as well as to merge multilevel apartments. When merging multilevel apartments, the areas are recalculated and the value of the "AP_Levels count" parameter is filled in. IMPORTANT: When recalculating apartments on a particular level, the parameter values of rooms belonging to the multilevel apartment, but located on another level, will not be recalculated
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction9: Locked apartments are apartments whose rooms will not be processed when collecting apartments. Apartments are locked on the "Collecting apartments" tab. Locked apartments are displayed in the list regardless of the current value of the "Apartment Identifier" (value of the "Functional purpose" parameter)

mprRoomColorVolume.Description: Showing the volume of rooms and spaces in color using DirectShape
mprRoomColorVolume.FullDescription: The Plugin lets you create DirectShape elements based on the volume of rooms and spaces in the model and assign different colors to the DirectShape elements you create. In the plugin window, you can group the created DirectShape elements by the value of the associated room or space parameter, and you can assign a single color to all DirectShape elements in the group

mprBreakLayers.Description: Breaking multilayer walls and floors into separate elements
mprBreakLayers.h7: Changing the settings is available in the full version
mprBreakLayers.t1: If "Last layer above wrap" is selected, but there are no layers above wrap, the top layer of the core will be taken.
mprBreakLayers.t2: If "Last layer below wrap" is selected, but there are no layers below wrap, the bottom layer of the core will be taken.
mprBreakLayers.t3: If the option "Structural material" is selected, but there is no layer with this option, the largest layer of the core will be taken.
mprBreakLayers.t4: If the largest layer of the core is not found, the largest layer of all layers will also be taken.
mprBreakLayers.t5: With break option "By core edge" the options "Structural material" and "Core biggest layer" take into account the properties of the initial layers of the element.

If the "Process elements in the document" option is selected then all types in the document are processed

mprParametrization.sld6: The strategy processes elements located in Rooms. You can use the strategy only in views that have Room geometry. For example, on 3D Views the strategy will not give results
mprParametrization.sld7: The strategy processes elements located in Spaces. You can use the strategy only on views that have Space geometry. For example, on 3D Views the strategy will not give results
mprParametrization.sld8: The strategy processes elements that have Solid geometry and are located in Masses. Masses must have a Solid form. Masses can be in linked files
mprParametrization.sld9: The strategy processes elements that have Solid geometry and are located inside other elements that have Solid geometry. The parent elements can be in linked files
mprParametrization.ssd10: Processing elements that touch their solids

mprParametrization.sld11: Strategy processes elements that are room boundaries
mprParametrization.sld12: Strategy processes elements placed in Structure Connections (Plates, bolts, etc.). mprParametrization.d-abs: Returns the absolute value of the number
mprParametrization.d-round: Rounds a value to the nearest integer or to the specified number of fractional digits
mprParametrization.d-roundup: Returns the smallest integral value greater than or equal to the specified number
mprParametrization.d-rounddown: Returns the largest integral value less than or equal to the specified number
mprParametrization.d-sqrt: Returns the square root of a specified number
mprParametrization.d-sin: Returns the sine of a specified angle
mprParametrization.d-cos: Returns the cosine of a specified angle
mprParametrization.d-tan: Returns the tangent of a specified angle
mprParametrization.d-asin: Returns the angle whose sine is the specified number
mprParametrization.d-acos: Returns the angle whose cosine is the specified number
mprParametrization.d-atan: Returns the angle whose tangent is the specified number
mprParametrization.d-log: Returns the logarithm of a specified number with a specified base
mprParametrization.d-ln: Returns the natural logarithm (with base e) of the specified number
mprParametrization.d-exp: Returns e multiplied by the specified power
mprParametrization.d-pi: Returns the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter
mprParametrization.d-if: Returns the first value <true> if the condition <c> is true. Returns the second value <false> if the condition <c> is not true
mprParametrization.d-and: Returns TRUE if all conditions <c> are true. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-or: Returns TRUE if at least one condition <c> is true. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-inrange: Returns TRUE if the number <x> is greater than or equal to <min> and less than or equal to <max>. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-has:
Returns TRUE if parameter

exists. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-firsttrue: Returns the first value of <v> whose <c> condition is true. If all conditions <c> are not true, returns last <v> value
mprParametrization.d-lstr: Returns the specified number of characters from the start of the string
mprParametrization.d-rstr: Returns the specified number of characters from the end of the string
mprParametrization.d-tmirrored: Returns TRUE if the target family is mirrored
mprParametrization.d-smirrored: Returns TRUE if the conditional source family is mirrored

mprSheetExport.h62: The print format is determined by the entire contents of the Sheet. After the Sheet is printed to pdf, it is trimmed to fit the size of the Title Block. This algorithm can cause regeneration of all sheets, which can lead to long loading of the plugin
mprSheetExport.h63: The print format is determined by the size of the Title Blocks on the Sheets. If there are elements on the Sheet that exceed the border of the Title Blokc, the Sheet will be printed incorrectly in the pdf. This algorithm does not cause regeneration of Sheets
